thread.title: Why some activists want Netflix held to a higher labor standard

author: Marissa Lang
title: Why some activists want Netflix held to a higher labor standard
text:
Photo: Brandon Chew, Special To The Chronicle 8566015|article-6485770|7 8566015|article-6485770|1 email_share_embed|photo-8566015|article-6485770|1 8566015|article-6485770|2 8566015|article-6485770|3 8566015|article-6485770|4 8566015|article-6485770|5 google_share_embed|photo-8566015|article-6485770|6 A broad coalition of activists gather in front of Netflix to protest the company's parental leave program in Los Gatos, Calif., on Tuesday, Sept. 1, 2015. A broad coalition of activists gather in front of Netflix to...
Netflix was lauded last month when it became the first American company to offer unlimited paid time off for new moms and dads. A broad coalition of activists gather in front of Netflix to protest the company's parental leave program in Los Gatos, Calif., on Tuesday, Sept. 1, 2015. A broad coalition of activists gather in front of Netflix to...
Netflix was lauded last month when it became the first American company to offer unlimited paid time off for new moms and dads.
